intro: Antidaphne paraensis, commonly known as the Brazilian peppertree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is smooth and grayish, and it produces small, round fruits that are red when mature. Antidaphne paraensis is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
